utterance: Crack three eggs on a bowl and whisk with a pinch of salt.
Heat butter or oil on a pan on high heat.
Add the egg mixture to the pan and stir the eggs for about 30 seconds.
When the eggs are set but look slightly wet, turn off the heat and fold the omelette.
After a few seconds, transfer the omelette onto a plate.
Heat butter and olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat.
Cook onion and garlic until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes, water, sugar, celery seed, oregano, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and puree with an immersion blender.
Reheat soup until warm and season with salt and pepper.
Hold a fork flat on the pan and stir the eggs thoroughly with one hand while shaking the pan back and forth with the other.
Keep incorporating the set edges into the runny center. This takes just 25 to 30 seconds.
Do you want to prepare a French omelette or a tomato soup?
